name: Sample size
definition: Minimum of 30 points is normally used but may not always be possible depending on identifiable control points. For feature level attribution sample 10 % of the feature population.

name: Search distance
definition: Search distance from the end of a dangling line.

name: Search tolerance
definition: Search tolerance of minimum allowable length in the dataset.

name: Maximum sliver area size
definition: The maximum area determines the upper limit of a sliver. This is to prevent surfaces with sinuous perimeters and large areas from being mistaken as slivers.

name: Thickness quotient
definition:
The thickness quotient shall be a real number between 0 and 1. This quotient is determined by the following formula:
T is the thickness quotient
T= 4 π [area]/[perimeter] 2
T= 1 value corresponds to a circle that has the largest area/perimeter 2 value.
T= 0 value corresponds to a line that has the smallest area/perimeter 2 value

name: emax
definition: Threshold above which the positional discrepancies are counted.

name: Sample size
definition: Minimum of 30 points is normally used but may not always be possible depending on identifiable control points. For feature level attribution sample 10 % of the feature population.

name: Sample size
definition: Minimum of 30 points is normally used but may not always be possible depending on identifiable control points. For feature level attribution sample 10 % of the feature population.

name: Tolerance
definition: Tolerance of differences in the coordinates for two datasets.

name: User defined maintenance
definition: TM_PeriodDuration described with at least one of the parameters described in ISO 19108:2005.

name: Maintenance and update frequency
definition: Frequency with which modifications and deletions are made to the data after it is first produced.

name: Maximum permitted age
definition: Maximum permitted age as defined in the data product specification.
